content: The 168-hour framework is introduced immediately after the assessment+gameplan handoff to kick off weekly execution. Jenny decomposes a realistic week (school 8h, sleep 8h, homework 4h, basics 2h) to surface a hard constraint: ~2 hours remain daily for high-leverage actions. This creates urgency, anchors weekly planning, and becomes the operating cadence for all execution: concentrate those 2 hours into proof-generating tasks (e.g., NCWIT scaffolding, outreach sprints, artifact production). The framework is revisited each week to reallocate time based on blockers and ROI.
insight_vector: Post-assessment execution framework: 168-hour time math exposes ~2h/day for high-leverage tasks; drives weekly plan focus
